comments:
- I have an .xml file opened in an editor
- I perform a java rename refactoring that modifieds the .xml file
- The file is not marked as dirty at this time
- I edit the .xml file and attempt to save it

At this point I  get an dialog with "Save could not be completed. Reason: Has
been changed on the file system." 

This does not seem to create an new error log entries, but I did see that the
below error was logged not to long ago.

Refreshing the project does not clear up the problem. Only an eclipse restart
seems to clear the problem. (Of course you must save off your edits somewhere
else in the meantime.)

----

When this problem occurs, and the xml file is open (but maybe its any non-java
file that is affected by the refactoring), the buffer of the xml file is /not/
updated. The contents on disk, however, /are/ updated. By closing the open
buffer, and doing a project refresh, the xml file can again be edited and saved.
I am no longer experiencing this problem with wtp 1.0.
